bio:treatment.discussion: Eriogonum evanidum is presumed extinct. The last known collections were made in Bear Valley in the San Bernardino Mountains, San Bernardino County, in 1931 (Templeton 1588, BRY, KANS, NY); Hemet Valley in the San Jacinto Mountains, Riverside County (Ziegler s.n., 10 Oct 1967, GH, RSA, UC, UTC); and the Pine Valley area, San Diego County, in 1938. It is related to two sprawling annual Mexican species with mostly elliptic basal leaf blades: E. foliosum S. Watson, with weakly hastate cauline leaves, and E. hastatum Wiggins, with strongly hastate cauline leaves.
